alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:57AM CDT until May 30 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR EASTERN LYON...OSCEOLA...DICKINSON...JACKSON...NOBLES...MURRAY AND COTTONWOOD COUNTIES... At 255 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lake Shetek State Park to Worthington to Sanborn, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Instrumentation. An observation site at Worthington, MN gusted to 59 mph at 2:53 AM. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Round Lake around 300 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Brewster, Harris, Dovray, Lake Park, Westbrook, Heron Lake, Storden, Lakefield, Orleans, Jeffers, Spirit Lake, Milford, Arnolds Park, Okoboji, Wahpeton, West Okoboji, Kilen Woods State Park, Jackson In Jackson County, Bergen, Terril and Superior. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
